intro: Psychotria nubiphila, commonly known as the cloud forest psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the humid, montane regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests where high humidity and cool temperatures prevail. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
